intro: Calceolaria chelidonioides var. parvifolia, commonly known as the small-flowered calceolaria, is a flowering plant native to South America. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments and produces showy, tubular flowers in shades of pink and purple. It is often cultivated for its ornamental value in gardens and greenhouses. The leaves are lance-shaped and have a hairy texture, contributing to its unique botanical appearance.
